Good man!
Those who wish to listen to the Dharma, now is the right time.

You should give rise to the same thoughts towards the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, give rise to the thought of great suffering within birth and death, and give rise to the thoughts of permanence, bliss, self, and purity towards great nirvana.

Good man!

It is like a seed that has not yet sprouted. When it obtains the combination of the four great elements and the work of human effort, it then sprouts. This is called the sprouting of the unsprout.

You should not now enter into the profound emptiness samÄdhi.

At that time, the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva Bright Light Universally Illuminating Superior Virtuous King addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

In the past, the Buddha said in the Ä€gama Sutras to Ä€nanda:

You say:

The essence of nirvana is neither born nor emerges, neither real nor false, neither produced by karma nor a defiled or conditioned dharma, neither heard nor seen, neither falling nor dying, neither of different characteristics nor the same characteristic, neither going nor returning, neither past, present nor future, neither one nor many, neither long nor short, neither round nor square, neither sharp nor oblique, neither with characteristics nor without characteristics, neither name nor form, neither cause nor effect, neither mine nor belonging to me.

It is like the eight-flavored water under the ground. All sentient beings cannot obtain it. A wise person makes an effort to dig and then obtains it;
